crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
Inspired by the NuSOAP WSDLCLIENT4.PHP sample file, the soap_manager :: class of the CRNRSTN Suite :: sits directly on top of the NuSOAP (0.9.5) PHP Toolkit for web services (SOAP server/client) support and development. When the soap_manager class is instantiated, an instance of a NuSOAP web services client (within the constructor of the soap_manager) will be created as well. This can be customized for different SOAP client (or connection) types as needed.
Three (3) parameters within the CRNRSTN Suite :: configuration file are used for successful instantiation of the NuSOAP web services client...WSDL_URI, WSDL_CACHE_TTL and NUSOAP_USECURL. If the running application has no need of web services, these defineEnvResource() method calls can be removed from the configuration file.
As specified in the crnrstn :: class documentation and examples, the NuSOAP.PHP and SOAP MGMT class definitions are optional and can be removed if desired.
If the running application is using web services and another SOAP client configuration is desired, the CRNRSTN soap_manager :: class can be modified to suite the purposes at hand.
Details for the default configuration of the soap_manager :: class NuSOAP web services client are as follows:
INSPIRATION :: WSDLCLIENT4.PHP,v 1.6 2005/05/12 21:42:06 SNICHOL EEP
WSDL CLIENT SAMPLE, BASED ON SOAP BUILDERS ROUND 2 INTEROP
SERVICE :: WSDL || PAYLOAD :: RPC/ENCODED || TRANSPORT :: HTTP || AUTHENTICATION :: NONE

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latests gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11
